Name: The Sun King
Ingredients: 22.5 ml Dutch Cacao white crème de cacao
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 drop Orange blossom water / Orange flower water
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of white chocolate & fig.
Review: Jay explained the origins of this drink as follows, " Whilst on holiday in the south of France this summer I discovered a fig tree growing on the riverside near our Chateau. During dinner, my family challenged me to make a drink with the figs. I raided the cupboards and found Martell VSOP, chocolate liqueur, tawny port and drinking chocolate. The rest is History! I hope you enjoy it! "
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2015 by Jay Decker at The Ivy in Chelsea Garden, London, England.
Nutrition: One serving of The Sun King contains 224 calories
